oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Interview - Jessi Colter - 2017-04-08
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interview with Jessi Colter from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on April 8, 2017. Interview conducted by Michael Gray. Includes audio from video and selected audio excerpts from recordings.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jessi Colter;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (09:18) Announcements by Abi Tapia / (10:33) Walk-on music continues / (13:02) Opening comments and Jessi Colter introduction by Michael Gray / (22:07) Opening comments from Jessi / (22:56) Jessi talks about her new book and audio release, how both projects were birthed and the impact of Lenny Kaye on the project / (25:52) Why the time was right for her to write a book about herself / (26:55) Jessi talks about her mother and early upbringing with music in the church / (29:15) Jessi talks about beginning to perform secular music and the reaction to that / (30:45) Talks about discovering country music / (31:42) Talks about beginning to write songs / (32:57) Jessi talks about how her songs found their way to recording artists through Chet Atkins / (35:27) Plays recording of Lonesome Road by Miriam Johnson AKA Jessi Colter / (36:57) Michael and Jessi talk about the previously played recording /

(37:52) Jessi talks about moving to Los Angeles and changing her ways of thinking / (40:11) Talks about her mother and her wise reaction to Jessi's changing lifestyle / (41:48) Jessi talks about hearing and meeting Waylon Jennings for the first time through Duane Eddy / (44:13) Jessi talks about beginning a relationship with Waylon / (45:45) Talks about changing her name to Jessi Colter / (47:50) Writing music during the troubled times with Waylon addictions and Waylon beginning to fight against the standard way of recording in Nashville with her help / (52:02) Audio from video of What's Happened To Blue Eyes by Jessi Colter from the TV show Pop! Goes the Country / (54:58) Re-discovering her faith / (57:17) Jessi talks about not having an issue with Waylon overshadowing her career and his encouragement to her / (01:00:54) Jessi talks about her thoughts on Waylon's spiritual journey / (01:03:43) Talks about Waylon quitting drugs /
